narrative.title: Ii Corps - 1942Q4
narrative.situation: American Army Corps (US) deployed in North Africa during 1942Q4.
narrative.objectives: First major US ground combat corps in European Theater. Operation Torch marked the American Army's entry into sustained combat against Axis forces. II Corps conducted amphibious landings at multiple points across French North Africa (8 November 1942), overcame limited Vichy French resistance, then transitioned to offensive operations into Tunisia against German and Italian forces. Doctrine emphasized firepower, mobility, and aggressive offensive action, though inexperience led to costly lessons at engagements like Medjez el Bab and (later) Kasserine Pass.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: coastal Algeria and Tunisia - coastal plains, agricultural areas, rocky hills, transitioning to mountains inland

special_rules: Combined arms coordination at division level

environment.terrain_type: coastal Algeria and Tunisia - coastal plains, agricultural areas, rocky hills, transitioning to mountains inland

data_source.extraction_method: Organizational records + Operation Torch data + group strength estimates
